meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel embarrassed, ashamed, or humiliated.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally spilled her drink on herself, which mortified her in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: His parents' public display of affection mortified him in front of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter's attempt to balance the plates ended up mortifying him in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: The embarrassing typo in the email mortified her beyond belief.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous prank was meant to mortify him in front of his crush.

meanings.definition: To subdue (the body or its needs and desires) by self-denial or discipline.
meanings.sent1: She tried to mortify her sweet tooth by avoiding sugary treats.
meanings.sent2: The monk would mortify his flesh through fasting and meditation.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to mortify his cravings for junk food led to some amusing food experiments.
meanings.sent4: The intense workout routine was designed to mortify the body into peak physical condition.
meanings.sent5: The strict diet plan was meant to mortify her appetite and improve her health.

meanings.sent1: Leaves left unattended will eventually mortify and become part of the soil.
meanings.sent2: The fruit began to mortify after being left out in the sun for too long.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten leftovers in the fridge started to mortify into a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant flowers began to mortify as the season changed.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree slowly started to mortify and return to the earth.
